title: Value of the derivative of an inverse function

content.question: Let f be the function defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mi>x</mi> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F78@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4039@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all x and the point (0,1) is on the graph of f, what is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>?</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A32@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
